title:
OMEGA Clocks’ Countdown Near Completion

The giant #OMEGA clocks at Trafalgar’s Square and Greenwich...

attachments.displayName: "Team GB Athlete Jess Ennis, LOCOG Chairman Lord Sebastian Coe, Mayor of London Boris Johnson and President of Omega Stephen Urquhart today revealed the official Omega London 2012 Countdown Clock in London's Trafalgar Square, marking 500 days to go to the start of London 2012."

object.content:
OMEGA Clocks’ Countdown Near Completion

The giant #OMEGA clocks at Trafalgar’s Square and Greenwich are preparing to finish their #countdown to the #2012OlympicGames, which begin tomorrow (July 27).

Both clocks have performed admirably, aside from a 7-hour mishap with the Trafalgar’s Square clock.

When the buzzer sounds and racers take off, OMEGA is responsible for accurate timekeeping equipment. The ability for these clocks to tell the time accurately is of the utmost importance, as OMEGA sponsors 25 Olympic games. OMEGA’s head of Olympic Timing, Christophe Berthaud, aptly expressed the importance of timekeeping with this sentence: “We want the medals to go to the right people.”

Crown & Caliber will be covering everything about time and the Olympic games in the ongoing weeks. What Olympic Games are you most excited to watch?

Watch a video on our blog here: http://ow.ly/cwoaB
